results.title: Remorques = Stormy Waters
results.brief_description:
The captain of a tugboat is happily married but, when he rescues a boat from stormy waters, he falls in love with the wife of its captain. He leaves her to keep a vigil at the bedside of his own wife who is mortally ill. An intimate and perceptive study of passion and the nature of fidelity which benefits from a Prevert script and a trio of France’s top stars. Filmed partly on location in Brest, work began in 1939, was hampered by the restrictions imposed by the Nazis and was completed 2 years later in a Paris studio.

Credits: Producer, Roland Tual ; director, Jean Gremillon ; writer, Jacques Prevert ; photography, Armand Thirard ; music, Roland Manuel ; art direction, Alexandre Trauner ; assistant director, Louis Daquin.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Michele Morgan, Madeleine Renaud, Fernand Ledoux, Jean Marchat, Nane Germon, Charles Blavette, Alain Cuny.

results.title: Remontons les Champs-Elysees = Let's Walk Back Up to the Champs-Elysees
results.creator_credit: Serge Sandberg, Guy Lacourt and Robert Bibal
results.brief_description:
In order to break the routine of his lessons, a school teacher decides to tell his pupils the story of the Champs-Elysees, from the Renaissance to Napoleon III. This light historical comedy is a pretext for Guitry to play five roles and to play games with historical facts and famous characters.

Credits: Producers, Guy Lacourt, Serge Sandberg ; directors, Robert Bibal, Sacha Guitry ; writer, Sacha Guitry ; photography, Jean Bachelet ; music, Adolphe Borchard ; stills photographer, Raymond Voinquel.
Cast: Sacha Guitry, Jean Davy, Jacqueline Delubac, Jane Marken, Mila Parely, Jeanne Boitel, Lucien Baroux.

results.title: Remodelling milk
results.brief_description: Australian research into the behaviour of milk proteins during heating and mixing has led to new techniques for processing stable skim-milk powders rich in protein. This powder can be transported relatively cheaply to recombining plants in tropical areas, where it is mixed with anhydrous milk fat and water, with or without sugar, to produce sweetened condensed milk or unsweetened evaporated milk. Traces the recombining techniques from pilot plant to full-scale commercial production.

results.title: Remnants of Eden
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Film Australia, Chedd-Angier Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Race to save the planet”.
This program examines the possibility that this generation may preside over a biological mass extinction of half the species on earth today. It addresses the delicate balance of protecting life’s diversity whilst managing the needs of growing human populations. Examples are taken from Kenya, United States, Thailand, Oman and Costa Rica. Narrated by Karina Kelly. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: Remembrance: Reverberation [exhibition documentation]
results.brief_description:
“Remembrance: Reverberation” was an exhibition held at ACMI Screen Gallery, 27 June 2003 - 31 August 2003. See Exhibition activity file record “Remembrance: Reverberation” (ID 12) for more information.
Are memories like movies? Can they be recorded? Can you capture their yearning, their dread, their jubilation? Featuring spellbinding artworks by leading artists from around the world in ACMI’s acclaimed screen gallery, Remembrance reveals how deeply our memories can move us.

An unforgettable experience that draws on the visitors’ own memories, Remembrance will affect everyone in unique and unexpected ways. Evoking and challenging the intimate memories that sustain and shape our past, present and future, Remembrance immerses the visitor in explorations from the romantic to the confessional, from the spiritual to the taboo.

results.title: Remembering Marilyn
results.creator_credit: Scotti-Vinnedge Productions, Asta Productions, Susan F Walker, Harry Arends and Andrew Solt
results.brief_description: Lee Remick hosts this tribute to screen goddess Marilyn Monroe, charting her rise to fame from her early years as struggling brunette photographer’s model to her later incarnation as a successful actress and blonde bombshell. This documentary examines the continuing appeal of Monroe and the private hell hidden behind the radiant public facade, and features rare footage of her teenage years, an early television commercial for Royal Triton Fuel, her appearance on the Jack Benny Show, her visit to Korea to perform for the American troops, her controversial rendition of Happy Birthday for President Kennedy, and clips from some of her most famous film roles. Also includes interviews with Gloria Steinem, Robert Wagner, Robert Mitchum, Susan Strasberg, and Monroe herself.

results.title: Remembering Life
results.brief_description: A history of Life magazine which first appeared in America in November 1936. Life pioneered pictorial journalism and in the process radically altered the course of the print media. Editors, journalists and photographers involved with its production, discuss the incredible power and influence had by this pictorial.

results.title: Remembering Janefield ...
results.creator_credit: Tribal Communications, Eastern Energy and Land Use Team and State of Victoria, Department of Human Services
results.brief_description: Provides a brief history of the Janefield Training Centre, Bundoora with both ex-residents and ex-staff members sharing anecdotes and moving reflections on their experiences and years at the institution.

results.title: Remembering Jacqueline du Pre
results.brief_description: The life of cellist Jacqueline du Pre was tragically cut short when she died of multiple sclerosis, aged 28. This film contains footage of du Pre in her element, practicing amongst friends and performing to receptive and adoring audiences. The second half of the program features performances. Extracts include Brahms: Sonata No.2 in F, Op.99; Offenbach: Duos for two cellos; Beethoven: Sonata No.3 in A, Op.69; Schubert: Piano Quintet in A, D.667 “The Trout”; Beethoven: Piano Trio No.5 in D, Op.70 No.1 “The Ghost”; Elgar: and Cello Concerto in E minor, Op.85.
